semantic_title: Excludes2 Notes - Conditions Not Included Here But May Coexist
section_path: Section I > A. Conventions > 12. Excludes Notes > b. Excludes2

content.full_text: A type 2 Excludes note represents "Not included here." An excludes2 note indicates that the condition excluded is not part of the condition represented by the code, but a patient may have both conditions at the same time. When an Excludes2 note appears under a code, it is acceptable to use both the code and the excluded code together, when appropriate. (Evidence: pg no: 10, L30-L31)
content.summary: Excludes2 notes indicate conditions not included in the code but may coexist and be coded together (Evidence: pg no: 10, L30-L31)
key_concepts: Represents 'Not included here' (Evidence: pg no: 10, L30)
Excluded condition not part of main condition (Evidence: pg no: 10, L30-L31)
Patient may have both conditions simultaneously (Evidence: pg no: 10, L31)
Acceptable to use both codes together when appropriate (Evidence: pg no: 10, L31)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Excludes2 conditions may be coded together with the main code when appropriate (Evidence: pg no: 10, L31)
detailed_rules.explanation: Unlike Excludes1, Excludes2 allows concurrent coding of related conditions (Evidence: pg no: 10, L30-L31)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify Excludes2 note under code
Step 2: Determine if patient has both conditions
Step 3: Code both conditions when clinically appropriate
Step 4: Ensure proper sequencing based on encounter

best_practices: Code both conditions when patient has Excludes2 conditions and main condition (Evidence: pg no: 10, L31)
common_mistakes: Treating Excludes2 like Excludes1 and avoiding concurrent coding
tips: Excludes2 is more permissive than Excludes1
Focus on clinical appropriateness for concurrent coding
clinical_context: Allows comprehensive coding of patient's condition
